skill.name: threejs-builder
skill.description: Creates simple Three.js web apps with scene setup, lighting, geometries, materials, animations, and responsive rendering. Use for: "Create a threejs scene/app/showcase" or when user wants 3D web content. Supports ES modules, modern Three.js r150+ APIs.

skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing Three.js tutorials and examples. No executable code, network calls, or file system access. Pure educational content for 3D web development.

content.value_statement: Creating 3D web content is complex and requires understanding WebGL, shaders, and 3D math. This skill generates complete Three.js applications with proper scene setup, lighting, materials, and animations using modern ES modules.
actual_capabilities: Generates complete HTML files with Three.js setup
Creates 3D scenes with geometries, materials, and lighting
Adds interactive controls and camera movement
Supports modern ES module imports from CDN
limitations: Creates simple applications, not complex games
Uses CDN imports, not npm package management
Focuses on basic geometries and materials
No server-side rendering or build tools

use_cases.title: Prototype 3D interfaces

use_cases.title: Teach 3D web concepts

prompt_templates.title: Basic 3D Scene
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Three.js application with a rotating colorful cube, proper lighting, and responsive design. Use modern ES modules.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Product
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Three.js scene showing a 3D product (watch/shoe/phone) with orbit controls, realistic lighting, and smooth materials.

prompt_templates.title: Particle System
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a Three.js app with thousands of animated particles forming interesting patterns, with mouse interaction.

prompt_templates.title: Data Visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 3D bar chart or scatter plot in Three.js with animated data transitions and interactive camera controls.

output_examples.input: Create a Three.js scene with floating geometric shapes that respond to mouse movement
output: Complete HTML file with Three.js CDN setup
Responsive canvas that fills the viewport

best_practices: Always include proper lighting - unlit scenes appear black with standard materials
Use Math.min(window.devicePixelRatio, 2) to cap resolution for performance
Import controls and loaders from examples/jsm/ path, not the main three package
Create geometries and materials once, reuse them for better performance
anti_patterns: Never create new geometries in the animation loop - causes memory issues
Avoid using legacy CommonJS patterns or global THREE variable
Don't forget to add objects to the scene or they won't render
Never skip the resize event listener - breaks responsive design

faq.question: Which browsers support Three.js?
faq.answer: Any browser with WebGL support (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge). Three.js gracefully falls back to canvas rendering if WebGL is unavailable.

faq.question: Can I use this with React or Vue?
faq.answer: Yes, but you'll need to integrate the Three.js canvas element. Consider using react-three-fiber for React projects or mount the canvas in a Vue component's mounted hook.

faq.question: How do I add this to my existing website?
faq.answer: Copy the generated HTML file or extract the JavaScript into your project. Ensure you import Three.js from CDN or npm before your custom code.

faq.question: Is Three.js free for commercial use?
faq.answer: Yes, Three.js uses the MIT license. You can use it freely in commercial projects, including client work and SaaS applications.

faq.question: Why is my scene black?
faq.answer: You likely forgot to add lights. MeshStandardMaterial and most materials require lighting. Add at least an AmbientLight or use MeshBasicMaterial which doesn't need lights.

faq.question: How can I optimize performance?
faq.answer: Reuse geometries and materials, limit shadow map resolution, use InstancedMesh for many objects, and keep triangle counts reasonable for your target devices.
